snippet: The retailer’s sales, hampered by extremely cold weather, came to $6.3 billion during the quarter, down 1.7 percent over the same period last year.
abstract: Macy's reports sluggish first quarter, saying its profit rose modest 3 percent in quarter ending May 3, 2014, but that sales dropped 1.7 percent from the year before; says it will increase its dividend by 25 percent, to 31.25 cents a share; Macy's earned $224 million, or 60 cents a share in the quarter, up from $217 million, or 55 cents a share, in the quarter in 2013.
lead_paragraph: The retailer’s sales, hampered by extremely cold weather, came to $6.3 billion during the quarter, down 1.7 percent over the same period last year.

headline.main: Macy’s Profit Rises 3%, Despite Declining Sales
